title: Tuvin - John (Book)
description: Tuvan is a Turkic language spoken in the Republic of Tuva in South-Central Siberia in Russia. The language has borrowed a great number of roots from Mongolian language, Tibetan, and the Russian language. There are small diaspora groups of Tuvan people that speak distinct dialects of Tuvan in the People's Republic of China and in Mongolia.

language.name: Tuvinian
language.area: Siberia, Tuvin Ao. Also in China, Mongolia.
